title: DeKalb County Jail Emergency Evacuation Plan

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents surrounding the DeKalb County Jail's emergency evacuation plan. My request applies to records maintained by or within the possession, custody or control of DeKalb County, including, but not limited to, the Dekalb County Sheriff's Office as well as any authorized sub-entity, agent, vendor or contractor. All guides, manuals, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other written policies, procedures or directives related to emergency evacuations of the people incarcerated in the jail in the event of fire, flooding, disease, or any other disaster, including all interim, draft or superseded versions, are included in this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Riley

title: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sharon Walsh and Michelle Lofwall

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Sharon Walsh and Michelle Lofwall
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails of Sharon Walsh (sharon.walsh@uky.edu) and Michelle Lofwall (michelle.lofwall@uky.edu) from January 2019 until today, July 29th, 2024. Please include all attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wes Anderson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. This may be one document with many policies, or all policies collected.

The original format of the documents is acceptable (PDF, .doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jesse Wozniak
